sen.j: シソ（紫蘇、学名：Perilla frutescens var. crispa）は、シソ科シソ属の植物。
sen.e: Shiso (紫蘇, Perilla, the scientific name: Perilla frutescens var. crispa) is a plant, a genus of Perilla that belongs to Lamiaceae family.
Shiso (紫蘇,Perilla, the scientific name: Perilla frutescens var. crispa) is a plant, a genus of Perilla that belongs to the Lamiaceae family.
Shiso (紫蘇,Perilla, the scientific name: Perilla frutescens var. crispa) is a plant, a genus of Perilla that belongs to the Lamiaceae family.

sen.j: なお、シソには品種が多い。
sen.e: Shiso has a variety of species.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shiso has a variety of species.
Shiso has a variety of species.

sen.j: それらの総称「広義のシソ」として用いる場合と、基本品種である P. frutescens var. crispa f. crispa （チリメンジソ）や代表的な品種であるアカジソ P. frutescens var. crispa f. purpurea を「狭義のシソ」として用いる場合がある。
sen.e: The term, shiso can be generically used as 'shiso in the broad sense', or 'shiso in the narrow sense' for chirimen-jiso, P. frutescens var. crispa f. crispa, which is a basic species, and aka-jiso, P. frutescens var. crispa f. purpurea, which is a typical species.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The term, shiso can be generically used as 'shiso in the broad sense', or 'shiso in the narrow sense' for chirimen-jiso, P. frutescens var. crispa f. crispa, which is a basic species, and aka-jiso, P. frutescens var. crispa f. purpurea, which is a typical species.

The term, shiso can be generically used as 'shiso in the broad sense,' or 'shiso in the narrow sense' for chirimen-jiso, P. frutescens var. crispa f. crispa, which is a basic species, and aka-jiso, P. frutescens var. crispa f. purpurea, which is a typical species.

sen.j: 本稿において特に明記しない限り「紫蘇」または「シソ」とは、「広義のシソ」の意味である。
sen.e: In this articles, except as specified, '紫蘇' or 'シソ' (shiso) signifies 'shiso in a broad sense.'
In this article, except as specified, '紫蘇' or 'シソ' (shiso) signifies 'shiso in a broad sense.'
In this article, except as specified, '紫蘇' or 'シソ' (shiso) signifies 'shiso in a broad sense.'

sen.j: 次のような逸話が伝えられている。
sen.e: There is an episode as follows
There is an episode as follows:
There is an episode as follows:

sen.j: 後漢末、洛陽の若者が蟹の食べすぎで食中毒を起こした。
sen.e: In the end of the Later Han Dynasty, a young man from Luoyang city ate too many crabs and suffered from food poisoning.
At the end of the Later Han Dynasty, a young man from Luoyang city ate too many crabs and suffered from food poisoning.
At the end of the Later Han Dynasty, a young man from Luoyang city ate too many crabs and suffered from food poisoning.

sen.j: 若者は死にかけていたが、名医・華佗が薬草を煎じ、紫の薬を作った。
sen.e: He was going to die, but Hua Tuo, a good doctor prepared a decoction from herb and made purple medicine.
He was going to die, but Hua Tuo, a good doctor prepared a decoction from herb and made some purple medicine.
He was going to die, but Hua Tuo, a good doctor prepared a decoction from herb and made some purple medicine.

sen.j: 薬を用いたところ、若者はたちまち健康を取り戻した。
sen.e: The young man took the medicine and recovered immediately.
The young man took the medicine and recovered immediately.
The young man took the medicine and recovered immediately.

sen.j: 「紫」の「蘇る」薬だというので、この薬草を「紫蘇」というようになった。
sen.e: The herb medicine was '紫 purple' and '蘇る recover' then it was called 'Shiso' (紫蘇 lit. purple recovery)
The herb medicine was '紫 purple' and '蘇る recover' then it was called 'Shiso' (紫蘇 lit. purple recovery)
The herb medicine was '紫' (purple) and '蘇る' (recover) then it was called 'Shiso' (紫蘇 lit. purple recovery).
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足'位置移動()補足

sen.j: ヒマラヤ山脈やミャンマー、中国などが原産。
sen.e: It originally came from Himalayan mountains, Myanmar, China and so on.
It originally came from the Himalayan mountains, Myanmar, China, and so on.
It originally came from the Himalayan mountains, Myanmar, China, and so on.

sen.j: 日本には中国から伝わったとされている。
sen.e: In Japan, it's considered that sisho was introduced from China.
In Japan, it's considered that sisho was introduced from China.
In Japan, it's considered that shiso was introduced from China.

sen.j: 一年草で、高さ1m程になる。
sen.e: It is a genus of annual herb with about 1m height.
It is a genus of annual herb about one meter high.
It is a genus of annual herb about one meter high.

sen.j: 葉は対生につき、広卵形で先端は尖り、緑色または赤みを帯びる。
sen.e: The leaves are opposite phyllotaxis, oval-shaped, acuminate and tinged with green or red.
The leaves are opposite phyllotaxis, oval-shaped, acuminate, and tinged in green or red.
The leaves are opposite phyllotaxis, oval-shaped, acuminate, and tinged in green or red.

sen.j: 品種によっては葉が縮れる場合もある。
sen.e: Some species have crisp leaves.
Some species have crisp leaves.
Some species have crisp leaves.

sen.j: 花序は総状花序で、白から紫色の花を多数つける。
sen.e: They have many white or purple floweres arranged in racemose inflorescence.
They have many white or purple floweres arranged in racemose inflorescence.
They have many white or purple flowers arranged in racemose inflorescence.

sen.j: シソには多数の品種や栽培品種がある。
sen.e: Shiso has a variety of species and clutivars.
Shiso has a variety of species and clutivars.
Shiso has a variety of species and cultivars.

sen.j: チリメンジソ f. crispa (Thunb.) Makino - 縮緬紫蘇。
sen.e: Chirimen-jiso, f. crispa (Thunb.) Makino

sen.e: Shiso in the narrow sense.

sen.j: 基本品種。
sen.e: Basic species
Basic species

sen.j: 葉は両面とも赤色でやや縮れる。
sen.e: The both sides of leaves are red, slighly crisp
Both sides of the leaves are red, slighly crisp
Both sides of the leaves are red, slightly crisp

sen.j: マダラジソ f. rosea (G.Nicholson) Kudô - 斑紫蘇。
sen.e: Madara-jiso, f. rosea (G.Nicholson) Kudo
Madara-jiso, f. rosea (G.Nicholson) Kudo
Madara-jiso, f. rosea (G.Nicholson) Kudo

sen.j: 葉の表面は緑色、裏面は赤色で縮れない。
sen.e: The front side of the leaf is green, not crisp.
The front side of the leaf is green, not crisp.
The front side of the leaf is green, the back side is red, not crisp.

sen.j: アカジソ f. purpurea (Makino) Makino - 赤紫蘇。
sen.e: Aka-jiso, f. purpurea (Makino) Makino
Aka-jiso, f. purpurea (Makino) Makino
Aka-jiso, f. purpurea (Makino) Makino

sen.j: 単にシソとも呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: Sometimes it's merely called shiso.
Sometimes it's merely called shiso.
Sometimes it's merely called shiso.

sen.j: 葉の両面とも赤色で縮れない。
sen.e: The both sides of the leaf are red, not crisp.
Both sides of the leaf are red, not crisp.
Both sides of the leaf are red, not crisp.

sen.j: アオジソ f. viridis (Makino) Makino - 青紫蘇。
sen.e: Ao-jiso, f. viridis (Makino) Makino

sen.j: 葉の両面とも緑色で縮れない。
sen.e: The both sides of the leaf are green, not crisp.

sen.j: カタメンジソ Discolor（栽培品種） - 片面紫蘇。
sen.e: Katamen-jiso, Discolor (culivar)
Katamen-jiso, Discolor (culivar)
Katamen-jiso, Discolor (culivar)

sen.j: 葉の表面は緑色、裏面は赤色。
sen.e: The front side of the leaf is green, the back side is red.
The front side of the leaf is green, the back side is red.
The front side of the leaf is green, the back side is red.

sen.j: チリメンアオジソ Viridi-crispa（栽培品種） - 縮緬青紫蘇。
sen.e: Chirimen-ao-jiso, Viridi-crispa (cultivar)
Chirimen-ao-jiso, Viridi-crispa (cultivar)
Chirimen-ao-jiso, Viridi-crispa (cultivar)

sen.j: 葉の両面とも緑色で縮れる。
sen.e: The both sides of leaves are green and crisp.
Both sides of the leaves are green and crisp.
Both sides of the leaves are green and crisp.

sen.j: 通常、食用にするのはアオジソとアカジソである。
sen.e: Generally, ao-jiso (green perilla) and aka-jiso(red perilla) are edible.
Generally, ao-jiso (green perilla) and aka-jiso(red perilla) are edible.
Generally, ao-jiso (green perilla) and aka-jiso (red perilla) are edible.

sen.j: 青紫蘇葉や花を香味野菜として刺身のつまや天ぷらなどにする。
sen.e: Ao-jiso's leaves or flowers are used as flavorful herbs, cooked in tempura or eaten with sushi as a garnish.
Ao-jiso's leaves or flowers are used as flavorful herbs, cooked in tempura or eaten with sushi.
Ao-jiso's leaves or flowers are used as flavorful herbs, cooked in tempura or eaten with sushi.

sen.j: 青紫蘇の葉は野菜としては「大葉（おおば）」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: As a vegetable, ao-jiso's leaf is called as 'oba'.
As a vegetable, the ao-jiso leaf is called 'oba'.
As a vegetable, the ao-jiso leaf is called 'oba.'

sen.j: 赤紫蘇梅干しなどの色づけに使う。
sen.e: Aka-jiso is used as coloring for umeboshi (pickled ume).
Aka-jiso is used as coloring for umeboshi (pickled ume).
Aka-jiso is used as coloring for umeboshi (pickled ume).

sen.j: また葉を乾燥させたものは香辛料として（特に京都で）七味唐辛子に配合されることもあるほか、ふりかけなどにも用いられる。
sen.e: Dry leaves can be mixed in a condiment called shichimi-togarashi (a condiment comprising red pepper and six other spices) (especially in Kyoto) or furikake (dried food sprinkled over rice).
Dry leaves can be mixed in a condiment called shichimi-togarashi (a condiment comprising red pepper and six other spices) (especially in Kyoto) or furikake (dried food sprinkled over rice).
Dry leaves can be mixed in a condiment called shichimi-togarashi (a condiment comprising red pepper and six other spices) (especially in Kyoto) or furikake (dried food sprinkled over rice).

sen.j: また、熟さない実を付けた「穂じそ」花が開き掛けの「花穂じそ」も刺身のつまに用いることがある。
sen.e: Also, 'ho-jiso' immatured fruits, or buds 'hana-jiso' are used as garnish for sashimi.
Also, 'ho-jiso' immature fruit, or buds 'hana-jiso' are used to garnish sashimi.
Also, 'ho-jiso' immature fruit, or buds 'hana-jiso' are used to garnish sashimi.

sen.j: 箸または手指で茎からこそげ落として使用する。
sen.e: They can be scraped from the branch, by chopsticks or hands.
They can be scraped from the branch, with chopsticks or with the fingers.
They can be scraped from the branch, with chopsticks or with the fingers.

sen.j: 実萼ごと食用とし、茶漬けなどの風味付けに用いる。
sen.e: The fruits including calyces are edgible and used for chazuke (hot tea poured over rice) as a flavor.
sen.cmt: 実萼 は 実：萼 のことだと思います。
sen.e: The fruit, including calyces, are edible and used for chazuke (hot tea poured over rice) for flavor.
The fruit, including calyces, are edible and used for chazuke (hot tea poured over rice) for flavor.

sen.j: ぷちぷちした食感と独特の風味がある。
sen.e: They have unique flavor and give sparkling feeling in the mouth.
They have a unique flavor and give tingling feeling in the mouth.
They have a unique flavor and give tingling feeling in the mouth.

sen.j: 漢方薬では、主に赤紫蘇の葉を「蘇葉」（そよう）または「紫蘇葉」（しそよう）といい、理気薬（気が停滞している状態を改善する薬物、精神を安定させる目的もある）として神秘湯、半夏厚朴湯、香蘇散などに配合される。
sen.e: In herbal medicine, aka-jiso's leaf is generally called 'soyo' or 'shisoyo' and is mixed in herbal medicines such as shen-bi-tang, ban-xia-hou-pu-tang, xiang-su-san and so on with the purpose of moving stagnated qi or stabilizing psychological state.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In herbal medicine, aka-jiso leaf is generally called 'soyo' or 'shisoyo' and is mixed in herbal medicines such as shen-bi-tang, ban-xia-hou-pu-tang, xiang-su-san and so on for the purpose of moving stagnated qi or stabilizing psychological state.
sen.cmt: grammar 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In herbal medicine, aka-jiso leaf is generally called 'soyo' or 'shisoyo' and is mixed in herbal medicines such as shen-bi-tang, ban-xia-hou-pu-tang, xiang-su-san and so on for the purpose of moving stagnated qi or stabilizing psychological state.

sen.j: （日本薬局方では、チリメンジソ（狭義のシソ、学名：P. frutescens var. crispa f. crispa）の葉及び枝先を「蘇葉」としている）。
sen.e: (Japanese phamacy regards a leaf and a branch of chirimen-jiso (shiso with a narrow meaning, scientific name : P. frutescens var. crispa f. crispa) as 'soyo'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (Japanese phamacy regards a leaf and a branch of chirimen-jiso (shiso with a narrow meaning, scientific name: P. frutescens var. crispa f. crispa) as 'soyo..

sen.e: (Japanese pharmacy regards a leaf and a branch of chirimen-jiso (shiso with a narrow meaning, scientific name: P. frutescens var. crispa f. crispa) as 'soyo.'
sen.cmt: ピリオド位置移動'削除スペル

sen.j: また熟した果実を「蘇子」（そし）といい、咳嗽、気管支喘息、便秘などの治療に用いる。
sen.e: Matured fruits are called 'soshi' that are used in treatment for cough, bronchial asthma, constipation and so on.
The matured fruit is called 'soshi' and are used in treatment for cough, bronchial asthma, constipation and so on.
sen.cmt: grammar 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The matured fruit is called 'soshi' and are used in treatment for cough, bronchial asthma, constipation and so on.

sen.j: シソの葉はロズマリン酸という成分を含み、アレルギー疾患に有用として健康食品としても利用されている。
sen.e: Shiso leaves contain rosmarinic acid that are effective against allergy disease and are utilized as a health food.
Shiso leaves contain rosmarinic acid that is effective against allergies and are sold as health food.
Shiso leaves contain rosmarinic acid that is effective against allergies and are sold as health food.

sen.j: アメリカ合衆国に自生しているシソは日本とは異なり、香りも異なる。
sen.e: Shiso growing in wild in the United States is different from that of in Japan, having different flavor.
Shiso growing in wild in the United States is different from that in Japan, having a different flavor.
Shiso growing in wild in the United States is different from that in Japan, having a different flavor.

sen.j: 日本のシソの香りはペリルアルデヒドという化学成分であるのに対し、アメリカのシソではペリラケトンが主成分である。
sen.e: In Japanese shiso, a source of flavor is perillaldehyd, a chemical component while American shiso contains perillaketone as a main component.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Japanese shiso, a source of flavor is perillaldehyd, a chemical component while American shiso contains perillaketone as a main component.
In Japanese shiso, a source of flavor is perillaldehyd, a chemical component while American shiso contains perillaketone as a main component.

sen.j: 外見の見分けはつかない。
sen.e: The both shiso are not distinguishable from their appearance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Both shiso are not distinguishable by their appearance.
sen.cmt: grammar 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Both shiso are not distinguishable by their appearance.

sen.j: ペリラケトンは肺気腫を起こす毒性があり、家畜が被害を受けることからアメリカでは毒草扱いである。
sen.e: Since perillaketone is poisonous, causes emphysema pulmonum that damages livestock, shiso is treated as a poisonous herb in the United States.
Since perillaketone is poisonous, causes emphysema pulmonum that damages livestock, shiso is treated as a poisonous herb in the United States.
Since perillaketone is poisonous, causes emphysema pulmonum that damages livestock, shiso is treated as a poisonous herb in the United States.

sen.j: 種子からはシソ油が取れる。
sen.e: Shito oil is extracted from the seeds.
Shito oil is extracted from the seeds.
Shito oil is extracted from the seeds.

sen.j: シソ油には抗酸化作用のあるα-リノレン酸を多く含むため最近では健康食品としても注目されている。
sen.e: Shiso oil contains rich a-linolenic acid, which has an anti-oxidant action and is being remarked as a healthy food these days.
Shiso oil contains rich a-linolenic acid, which provides an anti-oxidant action and is being remarked as a healthy food these days.
Shiso oil contains rich a-linolenic acid, which provides an anti-oxidant action and is being remarked as a healthy food these days.

sen.j: リノレン酸は酸化し易いため、同食用油の開封後は早めに消費する事が勧められる。
sen.e: Since linolenic acid is easily oxidizable, once cooking shiso oil is open, quick use is recommended.
Since linolenic acid is easily oxidized, once cooking shiso oil is opened, quick use is recommended.
Since linolenic acid is easily oxidized, once cooking shiso oil is opened, quick use is recommended.

sen.j: また2004年には国民生活センターがスチロール製容器を使用するカップ麺に入れた場合、容器が溶ける事があるとして注意を呼びかけている。
sen.e: In 2004, Japan Consumer Information center alerted that the oil could cause a styrofoam bowl of a instant noodle to dissolve.
In 2004, the Japan Consumer Information center sent out an alert that the oil could cause a styrofoam bowl of a instant noodle to dissolve.
In 2004, the Japan Consumer Information center sent out an alert that the oil could cause a styrofoam bowl of a instant noodle to dissolve.
